parameter 1: German standard version was modified (suicide squad became bomb bomb planter, nuclear rocket became aurora rocket) to secure a "Not under 16" rating from the USK. "Kane Edition" is uncut with a "Not under 18" rating.
parameter 2: German version is heavily cut: Hitler is missing from the introduction.  All soldiers have been replaced by Cyborgs.
parameter 3: The TV version uses censored version and replaces Cliff Richard with Bob Geldof.
parameter 4: For the German version all human soldiers had to be replaced by cyborgs (resulting in some goofs in the video-sequences and some logic-goofs f.e. the cyborgs getting poisoned by the tiberium).
parameter 5: The TV version uses censored version and replaces Cliff Richard with Bob Geldof.
parameter 6: Released on LP as Comic Relief Utterly Utterly Live (WEA Records 09321).
parameter 7: The original box art featured the World Trade Center being attacked and destroyed. This was changed after the terrorist attacks on the USA of 11 September 2001.
parameter 8: For the German version all human soldiers had to be replaced by cyborgs (resulting in some goofs in the video-sequences and some logic-goofs f.e. the cyborgs getting poisoned by the tiberium).
parameter 9: Available on CD-ROM with additional footage.
parameter 10: Available on CD-ROM with additional footage.
parameter 11: The original German version of C&C: Generals, already slightly cut, was rated FSK 16 (16 years and above) but was banned mainly due because of the Terrorists-faction. EA then released a new heavily edited version called Command&Conquer: Generäle. The main changes in this version were the cut of one GLA mission where the player has to attack UN-convoys and also kill civilians and the suicide-bomber unit was removed and replaced by some kind of RC-vehicle with a bomb attached to it.
parameter 12: Released on LP as Comic Relief Utterly Utterly Live (WEA Records 09321).
